ygData.subject: Re: Disobedient pets
ygData.msgSnippet: Try the command /pet back off.  That might do it.  Your pet should back off in a non-aggro manner as long as your are not being attacked and it is not being
ygData.messageBody:
Try the command /pet back off. That might do it. Your pet should back
off in a non-aggro manner as long as your are not being attacked and it is
not being attacked. I learned the command the hard way playing my mage.

Treilanin Loreweaver

On Fri, 23 Jul 1999, John Kim wrote:

> From: John Kim <kim@...>
>
> I've been playing with charm a lot lately (wonderful for
> pulling a mob off someone it's frenzied against), and I've
> noticed a recurring problem. Sometimes the mob you charm will
> attack a player (a party member in all cases so far) and will
> not stop despite repeated commands to sit down, follow me, or
> attack another mob.
<snip>
